MathML and W3C
David Carlisle
NAG
August 6th 2001
MathML 2
Released as a Recommendation in February.
New Content elements
csymbol Content extension element
New Presentation elements
New Unicode 3.1 and 3.2 character set
W3C Math WG
The Math Working group was recharted in June.
XHTML
XHTML Modularisation became a Recommendation just after MathML2.
A framework that allows XHTML to be extended (eg to add OpenMath or MathML or SVG) or subsetted (eg for Mobile phones).
XML Blueberry
Currently XML Blueberry is just a requirements document, but the W3C is contemplating changes to XML that will change the set of well formed documents
New XML Name characters (based on Unicode 3.1)
New XML White space NEL (EBCDIC newline) and LS
SVG
Achieved Candidate Recommendation status in July.
XPath 2
Xpath2 is currently in a planning phase as joint work between XSLT WG and a new XML Query Working Group.
XLink
XLink (finally) reached Recommendation status earlier this year.
Schema More on this later...
Semantic Web The Semantic web activity is currently a very high profile activity at W3C.
